intro: Lithospermum zollingeri var. albidum, commonly known as the white lithosperm, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southwestern United States. It features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs and produces small, pale pink to white flowers in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy on the upper surface. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its potential medicinal properties. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
